channel.title: Ryan Duffy - AI Infrastructure & Local LLM Journey
channel.description: Recent content on Ryan Duffy - AI Infrastructure & Local LLM Journey

item.title: Welcome to My AI Infrastructure Journey
item.description:
Why This Blog Exists

After months of building a local AI infrastructure stack, I kept encountering the same problem: most AI content online is either too theoretical or too enterprise-focused.

I wanted to share what actually works when you’re running LLMs on a consumer GPU - the real performance numbers, the gotchas, the configuration tweaks that made the difference.

What I’ve Built So Far

Here’s my current setup (as of October 2025):

item.title: Building the Foundation: MVP in 72 Hours
item.description: From vault design to working code in 72 hours. The 3-hour refactoring marathon, the first successful parse, and 6 content ideas from 1 conversation.

item.title: Day Zero: The ConvoCanvas Vision
item.description: The context window overflow error that sparked a 25-day process from idea to fully automated infrastructure. Looking back, this is how it all began.

item.title: The AI Awakening: Breaking Free from Context Limits
item.description: From context window frustration to local control. A 15-hour implementation marathon installing 17 local models on an RTX 4080 for persistent, private conversations.

item.title: Testing My New Blog Publishing System
item.description: First test of the Obsidian → Hugo → Cloudflare automated blog pipeline

item.title: About
item.description:
About This Blog

Hi, I’m Ryan Duffy, and this is my digital garden where I document my journey building a production-grade AI infrastructure on consumer hardware.

What I’m Building

I run a complete local AI stack on an RTX 4080:

  • 11 local LLM models via Ollama (Mistral, Qwen, DeepSeek)
  • vLLM server for high-performance inference
  • Kubernetes observability (Jaeger, OpenTelemetry, Kafka)
  • ChromaDB semantic search with 504 indexed documents
  • Automated workflows using Prefect

Why This Blog?

Most AI content is either:
